title: Fit a workflow with specific parameters — fit_results
code: library(tidymodels) #> ── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels 1.3.0 ── #> ✔ broom        1.0.8     ✔ rsample      1.3.0 #> ✔ dials        1.4.0     ✔ tibble       3.3.0 #> ✔ dplyr        1.1.4     ✔ tidyr        1.3.1 #> ✔ infer        1.0.9     ✔ tune         1.3.0 #> ✔ modeldata    1.4.0     ✔ workflows    1.2.0 #> ✔ parsnip      1.3.2     ✔ workflowsets 1.1.1 #> ✔ purrr        1.0.4     ✔ yardstick    1.3.2 #> ✔ recipes      1.3.1      #> ── Conflicts ───────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels_conflicts() ── #> ✖ purrr::discard() masks scales::discard() #> ✖ dplyr::filter()  masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()     masks stats::lag() #> ✖ recipes::step()  masks stats::step() library(xgboost) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘xgboost’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:dplyr’: #>  #>     slice library(modeldata) data(cells) split <- cells |>   mutate(across(where(is.character), as.factor)) |>   sample_n(500) |>   initial_split(strata = case) train <- training(split) resamples <- vfold_cv(train, v = 2, strata = case) wf_spec <- train |>   recipe(case ~ .) |>   step_integer(all_nominal_predictors()) |>   workflow(boost_tree(mode = "classification")) res_spec <- wf_spec |> fit_results(resamples) res_spec |> collect_metrics() #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   .metric     .estimator  mean     n  std_err .config              #>   <chr>       <chr>      <dbl> <int>    <dbl> <chr>                #> 1 accuracy    binary     0.477     2 0.00927  Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 brier_class binary     0.323     2 0.000424 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 3 roc_auc     binary     0.488     2 0.00514  Preprocessor1_Model1

title: Fuzzy Token Set Ratio — fuzzy_token_set_ratio
text: function computes fuzzy similarity score two strings based token set ratio methodology. considers intersection differences tokenized word sets input strings, calculates similarity score normalized string lengths.

title: Fuzzy Token Set Ratio — fuzzy_token_set_ratio
Fuzzy Token Set Ratio — fuzzy_token_set_ratio
text: s1 character string. first string compare. s2 character string. second string compare. score_cutoff numeric value (default 0) specifying minimum similarity score threshold. Scores threshold may trigger early exits computation.

title: Fuzzy Token Set Ratio — fuzzy_token_set_ratio
text: numeric similarity score 0 100, representing degree similarity two input strings.

title: Fuzzy Token Set Ratio — fuzzy_token_set_ratio
text: function performs following steps: Tokenizes input strings. Identifies intersecting differing tokens two tokenized sets. Computes longest common subsequence (LCS) distance differing tokens normalizes . Calculates similarity ratios intersecting tokens combined differing token sets. Returns maximum normalized LCS distance two intersecting token ratios. function short-circuits return 100 one token set subset . either input string empty, function returns 0.

title: Fuzzy Token Set Ratio — fuzzy_token_set_ratio
code: # Example usage: fuzzy_token_set_ratio("fuzzy was a bear", "fuzzy was a dog", score_cutoff = 80) #> [1] 84.61538 fuzzy_token_set_ratio("hello world", "world hello") #> [1] 100

title: Get a sentiments by language — get_sentiments_by_language
text: tibble word sentiment columns

title: Get a sentiments by language — get_sentiments_by_language
text: files generated way: chen_skiena_lexicon <- bind_rows( ::("P14-2063.Datasets", "readable_neg_words_list.txt") |> read_delim(delim = " ", col_names = c("word", "lang")) |> mutate(sentiment = factor("negative", levels = c("negative", "positive"))), ::("P14-2063.Datasets", "readable_pos_words_list.txt") |> read_delim(delim = " ", col_names = c("word", "lang")) |> mutate(sentiment = factor("positive", levels = c("negative", "positive"))) ) chen_skiena_lexicon |> write_fst( ::("inst", "extdata", "chen_skiena_lexicon.fst"), compress = 100 ) top_languages <- rlang::chr( ca = 'catalan', zh = 'chinese_simplified', da = 'danish', nl = 'dutch', en = 'english', eo = 'esperanto', fi = 'finnish', fr = 'french', de = 'german', el = 'greek', hu = 'hungarian', = 'italian', la = 'latin', pt = 'portuguese', es = 'spanish', sv = 'swedish' ) nrc_lexicon <- read_delim("NRC-Emotion-Lexicon-ForVariousLanguages.txt", delim = "\t") |> janitor::clean_names() |> pivot_longer(cols = anger:trust, names_to = "sentiment") |> rename(english = english_word) |> pivot_longer(cols = -c(sentiment, value), names_to = "language", values_to = "word") |> filter(sentiment %% c("positive", "negative")) |> filter(language %% top_languages) |> transmute( sentiment = factor(sentiment, c("negative", "positive")), language = factor(language, unique(language)), word = factor(word, unique(word)), ) |> glimpse() nrc_lexicon |> write_fst( ::("nrc_lexicon.fst"), compress = 100 )

title: Do the last fit and get the metrics — last_fit_metrics
Do the last fit and get the metrics — last_fit_metrics
text: res Tune results split initial split object metric metric use select best workflow

title: Do the last fit and get the metrics — last_fit_metrics
code: library(tidymodels) library(xgboost) library(modeldata) data(cells) split <- cells |>   mutate(across(where(is.character), as.factor)) |>   sample_n(500) |>   initial_split(strata = class) train <- training(split) folds <- vfold_cv(train, v = 2, strata = class) wf <- train |>   recipe(case ~ .) |>   step_integer(all_nominal_predictors()) |>   workflow_boost_tree() res <- wf |>   tune::tune_grid(     resamples = folds,     grid = 2,     metrics = metric_set(roc_auc),     control = tune::control_grid(save_workflow = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)   ) #> i Creating pre-processing data to finalize unknown parameter: mtry res |> collect_metrics() #> # A tibble: 2 × 13 #>    mtry trees min_n tree_depth learn_rate loss_reduction sample_size .metric #>   <int> <int> <int>      <int>      <dbl>          <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>   #> 1     1  2000    40          1      0.316   0.0000000001         1   roc_auc #> 2    57     1     2         15      0.001  31.6                  0.1 roc_auc #> # ℹ 5 more variables: .estimator <chr>, mean <dbl>, n <int>, std_err <dbl>, #> #   .config <chr> res |> last_fit_metrics(split, "roc_auc") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   .metric     .estimator .estimate .config              #>   <chr>       <chr>          <dbl> <chr>                #> 1 accuracy    binary         0.536 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 roc_auc     binary         0.523 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 3 brier_class binary         0.276 Preprocessor1_Model1 best <- res |> fit_best() best |>   augment(testing(split)) |>   roc_auc(case, .pred_Test) |>   pull(.estimate) #> [1] 0.5373975

title: Create an xgboost tunable workflow for regression and classification — workflow_boost_tree
code: library(tidymodels) library(xgboost) library(modeldata) library(future) data(cells) split <- cells |>   mutate(across(where(is.character), as.factor)) |>   sample_n(500) |>   initial_split(strata = class) train <- training(split) folds <- vfold_cv(train, v = 2, strata = class) wf <- train |>   recipe(case ~ .) |>   step_integer(all_nominal_predictors()) |>   workflow_boost_tree() doFuture::registerDoFuture() plan(sequential) res <- wf |>   tune::tune_grid(     folds,     grid = 2,     metrics = metric_set(roc_auc),     control = tune::control_grid(save_workflow = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)   ) #> i Creating pre-processing data to finalize unknown parameter: mtry res |> collect_metrics() #> # A tibble: 2 × 13 #>    mtry trees min_n tree_depth learn_rate loss_reduction sample_size .metric #>   <int> <int> <int>      <int>      <dbl>          <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>   #> 1     1  2000    40          1      0.316   0.0000000001         1   roc_auc #> 2    57     1     2         15      0.001  31.6                  0.1 roc_auc #> # ℹ 5 more variables: .estimator <chr>, mean <dbl>, n <int>, std_err <dbl>, #> #   .config <chr> res |> last_fit_metrics(split, "roc_auc") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   .metric     .estimator .estimate .config              #>   <chr>       <chr>          <dbl> <chr>                #> 1 accuracy    binary         0.532 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 roc_auc     binary         0.575 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 3 brier_class binary         0.258 Preprocessor1_Model1 best <- res |> fit_best() best |>   augment(testing(split)) |>   roc_auc(case, .pred_Test) |>   pull(.estimate) #> [1] 0.5621102

title: Create a tuneable glmnet worfklow for regression and classification — workflow_elasticnet
code: library(tidymodels) library(glmnet) #> Loading required package: Matrix #>  #> Attaching package: ‘Matrix’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:tidyr’: #>  #>     expand, pack, unpack #> Loaded glmnet 4.1-9 library(modeldata) library(future) data(cells) split <- cells |>   mutate(across(where(is.character), as.factor)) |>   sample_n(500) |>   initial_split(strata = class) train <- training(split) folds <- vfold_cv(train, v = 2, strata = class) wf <- train |>   recipe(case ~ .) |>   step_integer(all_nominal_predictors()) |>   workflow_elasticnet() #> [1] "logistic_reg binary classification" doFuture::registerDoFuture() plan(sequential) res <- wf |>   tune::tune_grid(     folds,     grid = 2,     metrics = metric_set(roc_auc),     control = tune::control_grid(save_workflow = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)   ) res |> collect_metrics() #> # A tibble: 2 × 8 #>        penalty mixture .metric .estimator  mean     n  std_err .config           #>          <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>      <dbl> <int>    <dbl> <chr>             #> 1 1               0.05 roc_auc binary     0.532     2 0.00461  Preprocessor1_Mo… #> 2 0.0000000001    1    roc_auc binary     0.505     2 0.000170 Preprocessor1_Mo… res |> last_fit_metrics(split, "roc_auc") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   .metric     .estimator .estimate .config              #>   <chr>       <chr>          <dbl> <chr>                #> 1 accuracy    binary         0.456 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 roc_auc     binary         0.5   Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 3 brier_class binary         0.257 Preprocessor1_Model1 best <- res |> fit_best() best |>   augment(testing(split)) |>   roc_auc(case, .pred_Test) |>   pull(.estimate) #> [1] 0.5
